conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Point A: Liquid flows downward and to the right, passing through the black baffle.
Point A: Liquid continues downward and to the right, passing through the yellow baffle.
Point A: Liquid flows into container E.
Point B: Liquid flows downward and to the right, passing through the black baffle.
Point B: Liquid continues downward and to the right, passing through the yellow baffle.
Point B: Liquid flows into container E.
Point C: Liquid flows downward and to the right, passing through the black baffle.
Point C: Liquid continues downward and to the right, passing through the yellow baffle.
Point C: Liquid flows into container E.
All three points (A, B, and C) direct the liquid flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
The liquid will flow into container E.
